snippet: People close to Charles J. Hynes, the incumbent in Brooklyn who lost the Democratic primary last week, say that he is reconsidering his resolution not to campaign as a Republican.
abstract: District Attorney Charles J Hynes of Brooklyn, after losing Democratic primary by wide margin to Kenneth P Thompson, is said by people close to him to be considering running for DA on Republican ticket; party leaders believe Hynes could draw voters to Joseph J Lhota, Republican nominee for New York City mayor.
lead_paragraph: People close to Charles J. Hynes, the incumbent in Brooklyn who lost the Democratic primary last week, say that he is reconsidering his resolution not to campaign as a Republican.

headline.main: Hynes Is Said to Be Weighing a G.O.P. Run for District Attorney
headline.print_headline: Hynes Is Said to Be Weighing a G.O.P. Run
